title: Child critical after being accidentally shot with BB gun
content:
LAWRENCEBURG, Tenn. — A Lawrence County boy is in the critical care unit at Vanderbilt Hospital in Nashville after he was accidentally shot in the chest with a BB gun, officials said.
Lawrenceburg Police detective Capt. Don Laws said Caleb Young, 10, was shot in the chest Tuesday night while outside shooting with the BB gun with another boy.
“Apparently, (Caleb) walked in front of the gun and he was struck at close range,” Laws said.
He said Young was taken to Southern Tennessee Regional Healthcare in Lawrenceburg and later flown to Vanderbilt Hospital in Nashville.
Reports indicate the BB punctured the boy’s chest and went into his heart.
Laws said the boy is in critical condition and was supposed to undergo surgery today.
“It’s sad, such a tragic accident,” he said. “Our thoughts and prayers are with Caleb ... and his entire family.”
